description: From Middle French opinatif, and its source, Late Latin opinativus, from the participle stem of Latin opīnārī.

adjectives.description: opinative (comparative more opinative, superlative most opinative)

entries.meaning: Conjectural; expressing an opinion rather than a fact.

examples: [Socrates] was an illiterate idiot  […] , to philosophers and travellers, an opinative ass, a caviller, a kind of pedant  […]
